title: I officially quit this pathetic game.
body:
After being told by loads of people, I spent a while facing bots (Even though I had already spent 3-4 weeks of just playing against bots, and every time I get really good CS and a lot of kills). But the second I go into any form of PVP, I go against the noobiest people in the world, who smurf just to win and basically completely ruin the game for new people like me. Not only do I face smurfs, I constantly get called a noob and that I should uninstall the game by my "teammates", even though I try to explain I am new to it all and am here to learn to play against people, as bots has become seriously easy. Not only do Smurfs slaughter me, then they either completely deny they are smurfs, or they start doing the bullshit of "rekt" and "cya" and other pathetic things. Now I understand not all are smurfs, but I know when some are as they can 4v1 you with ease and have almost perfect CS, if not more than double your CS in the first 10 minutes, and be able to completely push you in lane.

I can't handle this game anymore, it's just full of toxic people who have been playing years, and expect new people like me to be pro at it from the get go. I don't enjoy any of the games I play, due to being brought down by everyone in the game. So what's the point in me playing if I am not enjoying it at all.

Made my new NA account and went through a few bot games with other players, and had something I've never had before. Toxic players against AI's :-/.. I've never had anyone be toxic to me in a bot game, it's always a bunch of us messing around due to how easy bots are. But I got "I'm a noob" and "I'm majorly carrying you" because they had more kills than me (Most they stole off of me lmao). And they didn't like it when I pointed out I had double their CS, so they should be ashamed as I am a completely new player XD. Never thought I would see the day where toxic players also played against AI's and acted so good. They had 4 deaths as well to my 0, but they insisted they were better than me, called me every name under the sun, then said they were reporting me for "being toxic and taking kills". Is this what I have too look forward too within the NA community :P

I genuinely feel bad for the new players to league. I was playing on my level 16 account the other day and literally every game is loaded with smurfs. I know I'm part of the problem too but it's insane. I feel like there is almost no window for new players to enter the game anymore.

It gets a lot better past low levels, which is just a mixture of rejects and smurfs. Once you can stop playing blind pick, you get a much higher quality of player (relatively speaking).

This season just happens to be a bit of a clownfest, unfortunately. I understand the "fed up" sentiment.

Everyone keeps saying it'll get better, but when I am losing all games, it's going to take me forever to level up lol. I know I can face 5 AI's and level up that way, but there's no fun and I don't feel I'm learning when I can wander around and do anything I want too because bots very rarely go into the jungle and never use wards, so I feel I am not learning important things lol.

have you found a champ that you like? or a role? being really good at one role can help your performance a ton(but don't forget to do other roles)
bind pick is a living hell XD
trolls, feeders, smurfs, you name it, draft is ALOT better
i tend to stay away from ranked though

I love playing jungle, cause I feel I can control a game when I do well, and I have fallen in love with Elise's mechanics (Played her a lot when she was free, but need the IP to buy her now :(.) So instead, I try playing Amumu jungle, but I am just terrible at it. I can't get the hang of what items to go for, what skills to bring up first, where to start and other things. I have read and watched loads of things to do with different junglers and where to go and how to play them, but it's all hard to put into the game as I play it, cause I position myself wrong or I end up ganking too early or I get counter-jungled really hard.

for elise there arent many jgers like her, but once you get her you'll do fine, people make mistakes(i make them all the time, trust me) just keep practicing, and dont forget to have fun! if you need any tips just ask

It's the having fun part that's hard, when all your team is flaming at you because you keep messing up, and the enemy team are constantly doing thr rekt bullcrap after killing you, it becomes very belittling, and makes it really hard for me to enjoy the game, as I want to do well for the team, and yet I just fail instead.

yeah i know the feeling, ill go on massive losing streaks, one after another and i feel terrible, so i take a small break then come back, a great way to prevent toxicity is to play with friends, and just enjoy yourself

Here is what you do: dont play jungle as a lv12. 
Under 30, jungling is not even needed on a team, because the meta is so random and broken.

Most lv30 high silver/low gold players cant even jungle without feeding spectacularly. It is easily the hardest role that requires the most team cooperation, knowledge and planning, understanding of champion strengths, ect.
Top lane is the closest to jungle in terms of champion spillover and mechanics, but without the high level of strategic complexity. I suggest you wait until you are more experienced to play jungle in pvp. Practice in custom bot games until you understand what clear rotations and jungle camps different champions can handle.

Raptors are evil.

Draft will be a lot less toxic and not have as many smurfs and bots. People just play blinds to stop or troll.
